next we're going to move on to the
energy agenda
the number one discussion and possible
action regarding the proposed order and
docket number
un511 mississippi power company notice
of intent
of impico to amend its property damage
reserves and to change rates by
establishing a system
of restoration writer
mr mabry
thank you commissioners mr chairman on
october 25th mississippi power company
filed a notice of intent to amend the
company system restoration writer
or ss srr
and its notice of intent to change rates
in connection with the rendition of
electrical service
to its customers
mpc's annual srr funds the company's
property damage reserve which serves to
protect rate payers and the company
from the rate and financial volatility
it might result from uninsured property
losses such as those sustained in
hurricanes or tornadoes
since january 2020 npc has either
experienced or been in the projected
path of major weather events on average
every six weeks
the company began 2020 with a reserve
balance
of approximately 54 million dollars
as a result of weather events in 2020
and 2021
the reserve was depleted to a negative
balance of approximately 16.4 million
dollars as recently as september 30th
the first step in addressing this was
accomplished with the commission order
in docket 2021 ua 150 approved on
october 14th
this accounting order allowed the
company to move the restoration costs
for hurricane zeta approximately 38
million dollars in hurricane ida
approximately 11 million dollars to a
regulatory asset
to be recovered in the company's
performance evaluation plan 2021 review
filing
this replenished the reserve amount to
approximately 33 million dollars
after discussions with both staff and
commission the company determined a more
robust reserve is needed
this filing sets
a minimum balance to the reserve in the
amount of 75 million dollars
the filing also requests an increase in
rates sufficient to establish an annual
accrual of approximately 8 million
dollars until the target balance is met
a residential customer
with a monthly usage of a thousand
kilowatt hours will experience an
increase in billing of 96 cents per
month until the 75
million dollar target balance is met
this billing will begin on january 1st
to manage this change going forward the
company is proposing changes to the
srr's rate schedule
mpc proposes to create a band of 10
percent above and below the 75 million
minimum reserve balance
as the threshold for adjusting the
annual accrual
in any year the reserve balance is
projected to be above the 10 percent
upper limit the annual accrual will be
adjusted to be equal
to the projected changes charges to the
reserve
in any year the reserve balance is
projected to be below the 10 percent
limit the company may request an
increase in the srr factor
the 8 million accrual is sufficient
absent any major events in the company's
service territory there will likely be
major events therefore the company has
presented additional methods of funding
the reserve
one option that is included in this
current filing would be to utilize
revenues from pep
that exceed the range of no change as
defined in the pep tariff these funds
are currently returned to customers
either through bill credits or offsets
to future rate changes
the current filing looks to apply those
funds
as a positive addition to the reserve
balance the other proposed method
includes increasing the annual accrual
by the amount of regulatory asset
amortization
within srr upon completion of the
amortization period this option is not
being proposed in the current filing the
company will continue to research
methods of funding
the reserve to present to the staff and
commission in the future the staff has
finished his investigation into the
filing and recommends approval
